lines.value: this gave way to alchemy and the search for the philosopher's stone which was believed to bring about such a transformation by mere touch

lines.value: some consider medieval muslims to be the earliest chemists who introduced precise observation and controlled experimentation into the field and discovered numerous chemical substances

lines.value: will durant 1935 our oriental heritage simon & schuster the emergence of chemistry in europe was primarily due to the recurrent incidence of the plague and blights there during the so called dark ages

lines.value: this gave rise to a need for medicines

lines.value: it was thought that there exists a universal medicine called the elixir of life that can cure all diseases but like the philosopher's stone it was never found

lines.value: for some practitioners alchemy was an intellectual pursuit over time they got better at it

lines.value: paracelsus 1493-1541 for example rejected the 4-elemental theory and with only a vague understanding of his chemicals and medicines formed a hybrid of alchemy and science in what was to be called iatrochemistry
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: similarly the influences of philosophers such as sir francis bacon 1561-1626 and rene descartes 1596-1650 who demanded more rigor in mathematics and in removing bias from scientific observations led to a scientific revolution
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in chemistry this began with robert boyle 1627-1691 who came up with an equations known as the boyle's law about the characteristics of gaseous state
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: chemistry indeed came of age when antoine lavoisier 1743-1794 developed the theory of conservation of mass in 1783 and the development of the atomic theory by john dalton around 1800
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the law of conservation of mass resulted in the reformulation of chemistry based on this law and the oxygen theory of combustion which was largely based on the work of lavoisier
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: lavoisier's fundamental contributions to chemistry were a result of a conscious effort to fit all experiments into the framework of a single theory
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: he established the consistent use of the chemical balance used oxygen to overthrow the phlogiston theory and developed a new system of chemical nomenclature and made contribution to the modern metric system
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: lavoisier also worked to translate the archaic and technical language of chemistry into something that could be easily understood by the largely uneducated masses leading to an increased public interest in chemistry
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: all these advances in chemistry led to what is usually called the chemical revolution
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the contributions of lavoisier led to what is now called modern chemistry the chemistry that is studied in educational institutions all over the world
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: it is because of these and other contribtuions that antoine lavoisier is often celebrated as the father of modern chemistry
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the later discovery of friedrich wohler that many natural substances organic compounds can indeed be synthesized in a chemistry laboratory also helped the modern chemistry to mature from its infancy

lines.value: the discoveries of the chemical elements has a long history from the days of alchemy and culminating in the creation of the periodic table of the chemical elements by dmitri mendeleev 1834-1907 and later discoveries of some synthetic elements

lines.value: plasma also circulates hormones transmitting their messages to various tissues
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the list of normal reference ranges for various blood electrolytes is extensive
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: blood is composed of several kinds of cells occasionally called corpuscles these formed elements of the blood constitute about ۴۵٪ of whole blood by volume mostly red blood cells
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the other ۵۵٪ is blood plasma a fluid that is the blood's liquid medium appearing yellow in color
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the proportion of blood occupied by red blood cells is referred to as the hematocrit.thumb|left|230px|a scanning electron microscope sem image of normal circulating human blood
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: one can see red blood cells several white blood cells including knobby lymphocytes a monocyte a neutrophil and many small disc shaped platelets
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the normal ph of human arterial blood is approximately ۷٫۴۰ normal range is ۷٫۳۵-۷٫۴۵ a weak alkaline solution
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: blood that has a ph below ۷٫۳۵ is acidic while blood ph above ۷٫۴۵ is alkaline
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: blood ph along with arterial carbon dioxide tension paco ۲ ) and hco ۳ readings are helpful in determining the acid base balance of the body
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the respiratory system and urinary system normally control the acid base balance of blood as part of homeostasis
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: blood is about ۷٪ of the human body weight so the average adult has a blood volume of about ۵ litres of which ۲٫۷-۳ litres is plasma
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: human blood density is around ۱۰۶۰ kg m³
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the combined surface area of all the red cells in the human body would be roughly ۲٬۰۰۰ times as great as the body's exterior surface
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the cells are the term serum refers to plasma from which the clotting proteins have been removed
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: most of the protein remaining is albumin and immunoglobulins
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: see oxygen transportation
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: blood oxygenation is measured in several ways but the most important measure is the hemoglobin hb saturation percentage
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this is a non linear sigmoidal function of the partial pressure of oxygen
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: about 98.5% of the oxygen in a sample of arterial blood in a healthy human breathing air at normal pressure is chemically combined with the hb
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: only 1.5% is physically dissolved in the other blood liquids and not connected to hb
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the hemoglobin molecule is the primary transporter of oxygen in mammals and many other species for exceptions see below
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: with the exception of pulmonary and umbilical arteries and their corresponding veins arteries carry oxygenated blood away from the heart and deliver it to the body via arterioles and capillaries where the oxygen is consumed afterwards venules and veins carry deoxygenated blood back to the heart
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: differences in infrared absorption between oxygenated and deoxygenated blood form the basis for realtime oxygen saturation measurement in hospitals and ambulances
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: under normal conditions in humans at rest haemoglobin in blood leaving the lungs is about 98-99% saturated with oxygen
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in a healthy adult at rest deoxygenated blood returning to the lungs is still approximately 75% saturated
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: increased oxygen consumption during sustained exercise reduces the oxygen saturation of venous blood which can reach less than 15% in a trained athlete although breathing rate and blood flow increase to compensate oxygen saturation in arterial blood can drop to 95% or less under these conditions
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: oxygen saturation this low is considered dangerous in an individual at rest for instance during surgery under anesthesia as a general rule any condition which leads to a sustained mixed venous saturation of less than 50% will be poorly tolerated and a mixed venous saturation of less than 30% should be viewed as a medical emergency a fetus receiving oxygen via the placenta is exposed to much lower oxygen pressures about 20% of the level found in an adult's lungs and so fetuses produce another form of hemoglobin with a much higher affinity for oxygen hemoglobin f in order to extract as much oxygen as possible from this sparse supply
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: substances other than oxygen can bind to the hemoglobin in some cases this can cause irreversible damage to the body
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: carbon monoxide for example is extremely dangerous when absorbed into the blood
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: when combined with the hemoglobin it irreversibly makes carboxyhemoglobin which reduces the volume of oxygen that can be carried in the blood
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this can very quickly cause suffocation as oxygen is vital to many organisms including humans
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this damage can occur when smoking a cigarette or similar item or in event of a fire
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: thus carbon monoxide is considered far more dangerous than the actual fire itself because it reduces the oxygen carrying content of the blood
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in some small invertebrates like insects oxygen is simply dissolved in the plasma
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: larger animals use respiratory proteins to increase the oxygen carrying capacity
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: hemoglobin is the most common respiratory protein found in nature
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: hemocyanin blue contains copper and is found in crustaceans and mollusks
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: it is thought that tunicates sea squirts might use vanabins proteins containing vanadium for respiratory pigment bright green blue or orange
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in many invertebrates these oxygen carrying proteins are freely soluble in the blood in vertebrates they are contained in specialized red blood cells allowing for a higher concentration of respiratory pigments without increasing viscosity or damaging blood filtering organs like the kidneys
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: giant tube worms have extraordinary hemoglobins that allow them to live in extraordinary environments
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: these hemoglobins also carry sulfides normally fatal in other animals
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: when systemic arterial blood flows through capillaries carbon dioxide diffuses from the tissues into the blood
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: some carbon dioxide is dissolved in the blood
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: some carbon dioxide reacts with hemoglobin and other proteins to form carbamino compounds
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the remaining carbon dioxide is converted to bicarbonate and hydrogen ions through the action of rbc carbonic anhydrase
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: most carbon dioxide is transported through the blood in the form of bicarbonate ions
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: some oxyhemoglobin loses oxygen and becomes deoxyhemoglobin
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: deoxyhemoglobin has a much greater affinity for h+ than does oxyhemoglobin so it binds most of the hydrogen ions
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in humans and other hemoglobin using creatures oxygenated blood is bright red
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this is due to oxygenated iron in the red blood cells
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: deoxygenated blood is a darker shade of red which can be seen during blood donation and when venous blood samples are taken
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: however due to an optical effect caused by the way in which light penetrates through the skin veins typically appear blue in color
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this has led to a common misconception that venous blood is blue before it is exposed to air
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: another reason for this misconception is that medical charts always show venous blood as blue in order to distinguish it from arterial blood which is depicted as red on the same chart
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the blood of horseshoe crabs is blue which is a result of its high content in copper based hemocyanin instead of the iron based hemoglobin found for example in humans
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in mammals the restriction of blood flow is commonly used as a temporary provision of force as in an erection
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: hippocratic medicine considered blood one of the four humors together with phlegm yellow bile and black bile
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: as many diseases were thought to be due to an excess of blood bloodletting and leeching were a common intervention until the 19th century it is still used for some rare blood disorders
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in classical greek medicine blood was associated with air springtime and with a merry and gluttonous sanguine personality
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: it was also believed to be produced exclusively by the liver
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: blood pressure and blood tests are amongst the most commonly performed diagnostic investigations that directly concern the blood
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: problems with blood circulation and composition play a role in many diseases
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: blood transfusion is the most direct therapeutic use of blood
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: it is obtained from human donors by blood donation
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: as there are different blood types and transfusion of the incorrect blood may cause severe complications crossmatching is done to ascertain the correct type is transfused
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: other blood products administered intravenously are platelets blood plasma cryoprecipitate and specific coagulation factor concentrates
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: many forms of medication from antibiotics to chemotherapy are administered intravenously as they are not readily or adequately absorbed by the digestive tract
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: as stated above some diseases are still treated by removing blood from the circulation
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: it is the fluid part of the blood that saves lives where severe blood loss occurs other preparations can be given such as ringers atopical plasma volume expander as a non blood alternative and these alternatives where used are rivalling blood use where used
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: due to its importance to life blood is associated with a large number of beliefs
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: one of the most basic is the use of blood as a symbol for family relationships to be related by blood is to be related by ancestry or descendance rather than marriage
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this bears closely to bloodlines and sayings such as blood is thicker than water and bad blood as well as blood brother
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: blood is given particular emphasis in the jewish and christian religions because leviticus 17:11 says the life of a creature is in the blood the differences in sugars and protein sequences sets human blood apart from animal blood and this has been used as an argument for creation in religious circles
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: among the germanic tribes such as the anglo saxons and the vikings blood was used during the sacrifices the blots
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the blood was considered to have the power of its originator and after the butchering the blood was sprinkled on the walls on the statues of the gods and on the participants themselves
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this act of sprinkling blood was called bleodsian in old english and the terminology was borrowed by the roman catholic church becoming to bless and blessing
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the hittite word for blood ishar was a cognate to words for oath and bond see ishara
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the ancient greeks believed that the blood of the gods ichor was a mineral that was poisonous to mortals
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in judaism blood cannot be consumed even in the smallest quantity leviticus 3:17 and elsewhere this is reflected in jewish dietary laws kashrut
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: blood is purged from meat by salting and soaking in water
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: other rituals involving blood are the covering of the blood of fowl and game after slaughtering leviticus 17:13 the reason given by the torah is because the life of every animal is [in] his blood ibid 17:14 although from its context in leviticus 3:17 it would appear that blood cannot be consumed because it is to be used in the sacrificial service known as the korbanot in the temple in jerusalem
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: blood the blood of a lamb was also the means for antonement of sins for the jews
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: ironically judaism has historically been the religion to be most affected by blood libels
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: some christian churches including roman catholicism eastern orthodoxy branches of anglicanism and the moravian church teach that when consecrated the eucharist wine becomes the material blood of jesus
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: thus in the consecrated wine now the most precious blood of christ jesus becomes spiritually and physically present
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this teaching is rooted in the last supper as written in the four gospels of the bible in which jesus stated to his disciples that the bread which they ate was his body and the wine was his blood
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this cup is the new testament in my blood which is shed for you ().
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: various forms of protestantism especially those of a wesleyan or presbyterian lineage teach that the wine is no more than a symbol of the blood of christ who is not physically but spiritually present
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: blood the blood of jesus christ is also seen as the means for atonement for sins for christians
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: lutheran theology teaches that the body and blood is present together in with and under the bread and wine of the eucharist feast
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: mormons believe that before adam and eve ate the forbidden fruit blood was not present in their bodies
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: it is said to have formed after the fall when they became mortal
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: jehovah's witnesses do not eat blood or accept tranfusions of whole blood or its four major components namely red blood cells white blood cells platelets thrombocytes and whole plasma
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: members are instructed to personally decide whether or not to accept fractions and medical procedures that involve their own blood
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: vampires are mythological beings which live forever by drinking the blood of the living
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: stories of creatures of this kind are known all over the world
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: european versions of this myth are mostly inspired by folklore based on the stories regarding vlad dracula
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in chinese culture it is often said that if a man's nose produces a small flow of blood this signifies that he is experiencing sexual desire
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this often appears in chinese language and hong kong films
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this is also evident in japanese culture and is parodied in anime and manga
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: male characters will often be shown with a nosebleed if they have just seen a female nude or in little clothing or if they have had an erotic thought or fantasy
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: blood is one of the body fluids that has been used in art
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in particular the performances of viennese actionist hermann nitsch franko b lennie lee ron athey yang zhichao and kira o reilly along with the photography of andres serrano have incorporated blood as a prominent visual element
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: marc quinn has made sculptures using frozen blood including a cast of his own head made using his own blood
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: آنتیستنس په انگرېزي antisthenes د سپيانو فلسفې كلبي فلسفې بنسټ اېښودونكې دى
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: هغه ځاى چې ده د ښوونځي لپاره ټاكلې ؤ، د لوبو د لوبغاړي څنگ ته د سينارگس cynosarges په نامه ځاى، چې د سپن سپي مانا وركوي، وټاكه
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: دده مور يوه thracian
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: وه.his favourite style seems to have been dialogues some of them being vehement attacks on his contemporaries as on alcibiades in econd of his two works entitled cyrus on [[gorgias in his archelaus and on plato in his satho
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: his style was pure and elegant and theopompus even said that plato stole from him many of his thoughts
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: cicero however calls him a man more intelligent than learned ().
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: he possessed considerable powers of wit and sarcasm and was fond of playing upon words saying for instance that he would rather fall among crows korakes than flatterers kolakes for the one devour the dead but the other the living
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: two declamations of his are preserved named ajax and ulysses which are purely rhetorical
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: antisthenes was a pupil of socrates from whom he imbibed the fundamental ethical precept that virtue not pleasure is the end of existence
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in all that the wise man does antisthenes said he conforms to perfect virtue and pleasure is not only unnecessary to man but a positive evil
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: he is reported to have held pain and even ill repute () to be blessings and that madness is preferable to pleasure
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: it is however probable that he did not consider all pleasure worthless but only that which results from the gratification of sensual or artificial desires for we find him praising the pleasures which spring from out of one's soul and the enjoyments of a wisely chosen friendship
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the supreme good he placed in a life lived according to virtue virtue consisting in action which when obtained is never lost and exempts the wise man from error
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: it is closely connected with reason but to enable it to develop itself in action and to be sufficient for happiness it requires the aid of socratic strength ().
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the physics of antisthenes contained a theory of the nature of the gods in which he contended for the unity of the deity and that man is unable to know him by any sensible representation since he is unlike any being on earth
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in logic antisthenes was troubled by the problem of the one and the many
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: as a proper nominalist he held that definition and predication are either false or tautological since we can only say that every individual is what it is and can give no more than a description of its qualities e g that silver is like tin in colour
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: thus he disbelieved the platonic system of ideas which do not exist save for the consciousness which thinks them
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: a horse said antisthenes i can see but horsehood i cannot see definition is merely a circuitous method of stating an identity a tree is a vegetable growth is logically no more than a tree is a tree
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in later times antisthenes became to be seen as the founder of the cynics but it is by no means certain that he would have understood or recognized the term
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: aristotle writing a generation later refers several times to antisthenes and his followers the antistheneans but never associates him with cynics nor with aristotle's contemporary diogenes of sinope
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: there are many later tales about diogenes dogging antisthenes footsteps and becoming his faithful hound but it is not certain whether the two men ever actually met
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: even the story about antisthenes lecturing in the cynosarges gymnasium may be a later desire to link him with a place associated with cynic philosophy although as the son of a foreign born mother antisthenes would probably have frequented the place
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: it is true however that antisthenes adopted a rigorous ascetic lifestyle and he certainly developed many of the principles of cynic philosophy which became an inspiration for diogenes and many later cynics
lines.name: Pashto

lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: for the armed forces officers have to apply for admission into the inter services intelligence school
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: after finishing the intelligence course they can apply to be posted in field intelligence units or in the directorate of military/air/naval intelligence
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: then they wait and hope that their performance is good enough to be invited to the isi for a temporary posting
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: based on their performance in the military and the temporary posting with isi they are then offered a more permanent position
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: senior isi officers with ranks of major and above are only assigned to the isi for no more than 2 3 years to curtail the attempt to abuse their power
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: almost all of the director generals of the isi have never served in the organization before being appointed by the military commanders to lead it
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: isi also monitors former current and retired military officers who at one point or another held sensitive positions and had access to classified data
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: basic training commences with pep talks to boost the morale of the new recruit using patriotism religion and sense of honor and duty
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in this early phase the inductee is familiarized with the real world of intelligence and espionage as opposed to the spies of fiction
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: common usages technical jargon and classification of information are taught
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: case studies of other agencies like cia kgb chinese secret agency and r&aw are presented for study
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the inductee is also taught that intelligence organizations do not identify who is friend and who is foe the country's foreign policy does
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: after the initial phase the recruit is sent to the inter services intelligence school where training can last up to six months to a year
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the recruit is given firsthand experience of what it was to be out in the figurative cold conducting clandestine operations
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: during night exercises under realistic conditions he is taught infiltration and exfiltration
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: he is instructed to avoid capture and if caught how to face interrogation
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: he learns the art of reconnoiter making contacts and the numerous skills of operating an intelligence mission
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: at the end of the field training the new recruit is brought back to the school for final polishing
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: before his deployment in the field he is given exhaustive training in the art of self defense an introduction to martial arts and the use of technical espionage devices
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: he is also drilled in various administrative disciplines so that he could take his place in the foreign missions without arousing suspicion
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: he is now ready to operate under the cover of an embassy to gather information set up his own network of informers moles or operatives as the task may require
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: د مالوماتو ډلبندي data is sifted through classified as appropriate and filed with the assistance of the computer network in isi's headquarters in islamabad
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: متجاوزه استخبارات the primary mission of isi includes aggressive intelligence which comprises espionage psychological warfare subversion sabotage and promoting insurgency in enemy locations
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: د استخباراتي ضد عمليات isi has a dedicated section which spies against enemy's intelligence collection oganizations
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: with unscrupulous enemy agencies abounding in pakistani neighbourhood this is among the most important function of isi
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: spotting and recruitment isi operatives actively search for local recruits and operatives
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: separatist tendencies and ethnic or sectarian sensitivities are also allegedly used as grounds for manipulation such as the alleged involvement of isi with the khalistan commando force
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: armed forces and paramilitary personnels remain a primary target for enrollment
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: px200|کيڼ|thumb|د آی اېس آی يو پخوانی مشر، اختر عبدالرحمن چې د روسانو پر وړاندې د افغان جهاد بنسټگر گڼل کېږي
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: * ۱۹۸۰ isi became aware of a plot to assassinate the president of pakistan zia ul haq and then launch a bloody coup to depose the current government and install an extreme islamic government in its place
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the attempted assassination and coup was to occur on march ۲۳ ۱۹۸۰ during the annual march ۲۳ pakistan day parade
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the masterminds behind the coup were high ranking military and intelligence officers and were led by major general tajammal hussain malik his son captain naveed and his nephew major riaz a former military intelligence officer
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: isi decided against arresting these men outright because they did not know how deep this conspiracy went and kept these men under strict surveillance
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: as the date of the annual parade approached isi was satisfied that it had identified the major players in this conspiracy and then arrested these men along with quite a few high ranking military officers.<ref name="profiles of intelligence">
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: * ۱۹۷۹ after the failure of operation eagle claw the us media outlets such as newsweek and time reported that cia agents stationed in tehran had obtained information in regard to the location of the hostages in house information from a pakistani cook who used to work for the us embassy
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: isi successfully gathered evidence and intercepted communication documents and showed it to the iranian chief of j-۲ which cleared the cook
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the iranian chief of intelligence said we know the big satan is a big liar
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: * ۱۹۸۰ isi had placed a mole in the soviet union's embassy in islamabad
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the mole reported that the third secretary in the soviet embassy was after information in regard to the karakurum highway and was obtaining it from a middle level employee mr ejaz of the northern motor transport company
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: isi contacted mr ejaz who then confessed that a few months ago the soviet diplomat approached him and threatened his family unless he divulged sensitive information in regard to the highway such as alignment of the road location of bridges the number of chinese personnel working on the highway etc the isi instead of confronting the soviet diplomat chose to feed him with false information
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this continued until the soviet diplomat was satisfied that mr ejaz had been bled white of all the information and then dropped him as a source
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: [[انځور:kahutablueprint.jpg|thumb|کيڼ|150px|ordinance blueprint,khan research laboratories aq khan laboratories engineering research laboratories erl کهوټا پاکستان ۳۳°۳۹'۱۱"n ۷۳°۱۵'۳۳"e.]] * ۱۹۹۱-۱۹۹۳ major general sultan habib who was an operative of the isi's joint intelligence miscellaneous department successfully procured nuclear material while being posted as the defense attache in the pakistani embassy in moscow from ۱۹۹۱ to ۱۹۹۳ and concurrently obtaining other materials from central asian republics poland and the former czechoslovakia
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: after moscow major general habib then coordinated shipping of missiles from north korea and the training of pakistani experts in the missile production
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: these two acts greatly enhanced pakistan's nuclear weapons program and their missile delivery systems
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the ۱۹۹۰ elections for example were widely believed to have been rigged by the isi in favor of the islami jamhoori ittehad iji party a of nine mainly rightist parties by the isi under lt general hameed gul to ensure the defeat of bhutto's pakistan peoples party ppp in the polls
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: gul has denied that the vote was rigged
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in september october ۱۹۸۹ two isi officers launched operation midnight jackals in a bid to sway ppp members of the national assembly to back a vote of no confidence against the bhutto government
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in early ۱۹۹۰s isi became involved in politics of karachi it launched operation against the mujahir qaumi movement mqm seeing its growing popularity and political strength in the province of sindh
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: it is alleged that isi was involved in dividing mqm
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this led to the creation of mqm a and mqm h the former being the party of altaf hussain and latter haqiqi group
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: mqm haqiqi group was made by isi to target mqm a and to stop its growing popularity
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: it even bribed several journalists and newspapers to agitate against mqm a
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: isi's internal political division has been accused by various members of the pakistan people's party in assassinating shahnawaz bhutto one of the two brothers of benazir bhutto through poisoning in the french riviera in the middle of ۱۹۸۵ in an attempt to intimidate her into not returning to pakistan for directing the movement against zia's military government but no proof has been found implicating the isi
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the isi was also involved in a massive corruption scandal dubbed mehrangate in which top isi and army brass were given large sums of money by yunus habib the owner of mehran bank to deposit isi's foreign exchange reserves in mehran bank
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this was against government policy as such banking which involves government institutions can only be done through state owned financial institutions and not private banks
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: when the new director of the isi was appointed and then proceeded to withdraw the money from mehran bank and back into state owned financial institutions the money had been used up in financing habib's extracurricular activities
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: on april ۲۰ ۱۹۹۴ habib was arrested and the scandal became public
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: india has blamed the isi for training arming and giving logistics to the militants who are fighting the indian security forces in indian administered kashmir
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: federation of american scientists reports that the inter service intelligence is the main supplier of funds and arms to the militant groups
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the british government had stated there is a clear link between pakistan's inter services intelligence and three major militant outfits the guardian newspaper had uncovered evidence that pakistani militants were openly raising funds and training new recruits and that the isi's kashmir cell was instrumental in funding and controlling these outfits
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: india also accused isi of masterminding the ۱۹۹۳ mumbai bombings with backing from dawood ibrahim's d company
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: aside from kashmir india accuses the isi of running training camps near the border of bangladesh in late ۱۹۹۰s where india claims the isi trains members of various separatist groups from the northeastern indian states
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the isi has denied these accusations
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in january ۱۹۹۳ the united states placed pakistan on the watch list of such countries which were suspected of sponsoring international terrorism
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this decision was made in part because the current head of the isi in ۱۹۹۳ lt gen nasir had become a stumbling block in american efforts to buy back hundreds of shoulder fired surface to air fim-۹۲ stinger missiles from the afghan mujahideen and was assisting organizations such as harkat ul ansar which had been branded as a terrorist organization by the us
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: once nasir's tenure as isi chief ended the us removed pakistan from the terrorism watch list
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the isi is also suspected to have been involved with the hijackers of the september ۱۱ ۲۰۰۱ attacks having paid the ringleader mohamed atta
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: after ۹/۱۱ isi was purged of members who did not support president pervez musharraf's stance towards the taliban and al qaeda
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in the bbc newsnight programme on ۲۷ september ۲۰۰۶ a research paper prepared for the ministry of defence united kingdom was quoted linking the isi with support for the taliban and other terrorist acts in the west
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the report states the us/uk cannot begin to turn the tide until they identify the real enemies from attacking ideas tactically and seek to put in place a more just vision
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this will require pakistan to move away from army rule and for the isi to be dismantled and more significantly something to be put in its place this was denied by president musharraf i totally ۲۰۰٪ reject it
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: i reject it from anybody mod or anyone who tells me to dismantle isi the council on foreign relations a us foreign policy think tank published an article casting doubt on some of the accusations though pakistan does offer safe haven to kashmiri groups and perhaps some taliban fighters the suggestion that the isi is responsible for the ۷/۷ bombings of london's mass transit system is a real stretch [kathy] gannon says
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: however a later report by the same think tank the council on foreign relations stated there was probably support for terrorism from rogue elements of the isi
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: amnesty international publish a report on ۲۹ september ۲۰۰۶ accusing pakistan of detaining hundreds of alleged terror suspects without legal process
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the group says some were tortured or otherwise ill treated others were sold to the us military and others have vanished without trace
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: journalists and human rights activists have told amnesty international that most terror suspects deemed important by pakistani intelligence were held in safe houses run by the agencies - pakistan's intelligence agencies including the inter services intelligence isi and military intelligence mi in many cases us agents paid a bounty of $۵٬۰۰۰ ۲٬۶۶۷ uk pounds to those usually intelligence agents who simply declared people terrorists seized them and handed them over for interrogation with no legal process amnesty said
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: enforced disappearances were almost unheard of in pakistan before the start of the u.s-led war on terror now they are a growing phenomenon spreading beyond terror suspects amnesty researcher angelika pathak said gen musharraf strongly denied the allegations that some alleged terror suspects had vanished without trace i don't want even to reply to that it is a nonsense i don't believe it i don't trust it
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: gen musharraf has boasted of the arrests as proof of his commitment to the fight against al qaida
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in his new memoirs in the line of fire he claims that the cia has paid pakistan hundreds of millions of dollars in bounty payments for the capture of ۳۶۹ al qaida suspects since ۲۰۰۱ some members of the american media and political establishment have questioned pakistan's commitment in combating the taliban and al qaeda remnants in border areas
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in response pakistan has pointed to the deployment of nearly ۸۰٬۰۰۰ troops in the border areas and the arrests of more than ۷۰۰ al qaeda members carried out by mostly isi members the most high profile ones including ۹/۱۱ mastermind khalid sheikh mohammed as proof that the isi was serious in its commitment to fighting the war on terrorism
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: however the recent deal with the rebels to end the waziristan war has been seen by many observers as a defeat for pakistan that has strengthened taliban powerbase in waziristan
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: moreover nato's top commanders have criticized isi's continued role in supplying weapons and providing sanctuary to the terrorists but have approved the deal
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: isi is accused by india alot of times but its involvement has never been proved which shows that its just a blame game
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: نصرت پارسا د فبروري ۲۲ ۱۹۶۹–مۍ ۸ ۲۰۰۵ يو افغان سندرغاړی وه
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: according to nasrat's personal account he was first discovered after singing the songs of ahmad zahir on a national radio broadcast
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: after the singer heard the renditions of his songs by the 7 year old nasrat he got in touch with the child and invited him to sing with him
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: thus was nasrat's formal initiation into singing
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: due to soviet occupation of afghanistan and the ensuing disruptive guerrilla fighting nasrat parsa and his family left afghanistan in 1981 for pakistan and subsequently to india
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: they took residence in the capital city of new delhi a popular destination for most afghan war civilians
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: there the 12 year old emigre was said to delve into studying music to find comfort from the negative psychological effects of the war
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: he attended the school of music under the apprenticeship of classic indian singer daish pandi
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: although the classical music of afghanistan and indian classical music differ considerably in tone and rhythm the training nonetheless gave nasrat a foundation to prepare his voice and gave encouragement to the amateur to pursue his interest professionally
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: he also studied with ustad monawar ali khan a leading authority in certain indian music styles who taught him details of musical instruments and notes
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: he became one of the few afghan singers who had a formal training in classical music
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: it was these lessons that would prepare him for performing the ghazals that he later became known for in europe
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: after a few transition years in india nasrat and his family immigrated to germany
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: establishing contact with other fellow countrymen in hamburg nasrat became more involved in the music scene with the other exiled afghan singers and musicians
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: from his initial involvements in private parties to the formal weddings where strong singing background is considered nasrat's name ranked high on the choice list
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: at this time he started working on recording professional albums as well
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: his initial works met with moderate notability however they were commercially steady in success
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: at weddings he was acclaimed for the warm welcoming of the bride and groom with his number maa destmal aawordaim ما دستمال آورديم ) gohar album which roughly translates as we've brought our brother's bride this album established nasrat as a respected singer and also garnered him praise of critics
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: as a matter of fact the monumentalizing of the bride and groom union following the entrance anthem of ahesta boro آهسته برو in weddings with the hit song of the gohar album is now a strong tradition of afghan weddings
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: his performances hereon became regular and he often teamed with other singers to perform in various cities outside of germany
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in 2005 nasrat parsa was invited to perform at a concert in vancouver on the occasion of mother's day opening a comprehensive tour that was scheduled to include several cities in north america
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: at the height of his popularity and on the occasion of promoting his upcoming album dil the singer flew to canada where he performed to a large crowd of fans some of whom saw him live on stage for the first time
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: although the event itself went smoothly the developments later on in the night was to etch a tragic mark
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: shortly after reaching his hotel room after the performance nasrat was approached by a group of young men claiming to be his fans
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: there he was confronted by them about snubbing their request for singing fast songs that forced the drunken group to walk around idly instead of engaging them in festivity of dancing
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: although the singer maintained he was being respectful to the attending mothers who came to his concert on the occasion of mother's day one of the infuriated men a 19 year old ahmad saier froogh dissatisfied with the justification unexpectedly punched the singer in the face
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this caused him to slump in shock and lose his balance
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: since nasrat had the disadvantage of position over the stairs he fell hitting his head on one of the concrete cases in a severe blow that had gained force with the momentum of the full fall
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: immediately unconscious the singer didn't recover from his injuries
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: on sunday may 8 2005 at 11:15pm pacific time nasrat ali parsa 36 was pronounced dead at a vancouver hospital
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: on may 12 2005 nasrat parsa's body was flown back to germany for burial
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the grief stricken bereaved family members and fans around the world individually held services to honor the late singer
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: notably the funeral held at sayed jamaladen masjid by habib qaderi on may 15 2005 in orange usa drew thousands of sorrowful fans
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: other cities in the usa canada europe australia and afghanistan also held similar mourning sessions
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: on may 13 2005 a candle light vigil was held in memory of the late singer in laguna beach usa
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the event which drew many fans and sympathizers called for a conscious effort to respect all afghan singers
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: furthermore it called for active action against violence in future concert events to protect the other musical assets of afghanistan
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the vigil was held with an islamic theme to honor his family's religious tradition
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: similar ceremonies were also held thereafter in various cities around the world in honor of the singer
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: we are deeply saddened and deeply touched by nasrat parsa's death
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: singers are the moral property of a society gholam mohamed yosufzai acting deputy minister of information of afghanistan in agence france presse may 10 2005 the death of parsa on mother's day must have been heart stopping news for his mother and family salim alim music retailer cbc.ca news may 10 2005 he never smiled in any of his pictures....perhaps he had sensed his life's tragic end at the hands of his countrymen beforehand ozair ( nasrat parsa vigil laguna beach ca may 13 2005
lines.name: Pashto
