lines.value: however muslims reject the christian theology concerning the trinity of god the doctrine of the trinity which regards jesus as the eternal son of god seeing it as akin to polytheism
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: quoting from the qur'an sura an nisa(۴ :۱۷۱: :'"o people of the scripture
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: do not transgress the limits of your religion and do not say about god except the truth
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the messiah jesus the son of mary was only a messenger of god and his word that he had sent to mary and a revelation from him
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: therefore you shall believe in god and his messengers
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: you shall not say trinity
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: you shall refrain from this for your own good
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: god is only one god
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: be he glorified he is much too glorious to have a son
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: to him belongs everything in the heavens and everything on earth
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: god suffices as lord and master no muslim visual images or depictions of god exist because such artistic depictions may lead to idolatry and are thus disdained
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: such aniconism can also be found in judeo christian theology
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: moreover most muslims believe that god is incorporeal making any two or three dimensional depictions impossible
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: instead muslims describe god by the many divine attributes mentioned in the qur'an
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: all but one sura chapter of the qur'an begins with the phrase in the name of allah the beneficent the merciful
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: these are regarded as the most important divine attributes at least in the sense that muslims repeat them most frequently during their prayers salat and throughout their daily lives
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: there are numerous traditions and many conflicting academic theories as to the provenance of the qur'anic verses that were eventually assembled into a single volume
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this is covered in greater detail in qur'an
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: most muslims accept the account recorded in several hadith which state that abu bakr the first caliph ordered his personal secretary zayd ibn thabit to collect and record all the authentic verses of the qur'an as preserved in written form or oral tradition
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: zayd's written collection privately treasured by prophet muhammad's wife hafsa bint umar was according to muslim sources later used by uthman and is thus the basis of today's qur'an
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: uthman's version organized the suras roughly in order of length excepting the brief opening surah al fatiha with the longest suras at the start of the qur'an and the shortest ones at the end
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: more conservative views state that the order of most suras was divinely set
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: later scholars have struggled to put the suras in chronological order and among muslim commentators at least there is a rough consensus as to which suras were revealed in mecca and which at medina with distinctive characteristics observed within these two subgroups
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: some suras e.g surat iqra are thought to have been revealed in parts at separate times
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: to understand the notion of variants within the received qur'anic text one must understand that arabic had not yet fully developed as a written language
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the qur'an was first recorded in written form date uncertain in the hijazi mashq ma'il and kufic scripts these scripts write consonants only and do not supply vowels
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: imagine an english text that wrote the word bed as bd and required the reader to infer from context that the reference was to bed and not to bad or bide because there were differing oral traditions of recitation as non native arabic speakers converted to islam there was some disagreement as to the exact reading of many vowel-free verses
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: eventually scripts were developed that used diacritical markings known as points to indicate the vowels
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: for hundreds of years after uthman's recension muslim scholars argued as to the correct pointing and reading of uthman's unpointed official text
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: eventually most commentators accepted seven variant readings qira'at of the qur'an as canonical while agreeing that the differences among the seven are minor and do not affect the meaning of the text.the form of the qur'an most used today is the al azhar text of ۱۹۲۳ prepared by a committee at the prestigious cairo university of al azhar
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the qur'an early became a focus of muslim devotion and eventually a subject of theological controversy among skeptics
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in the ۸th century the mu'tazilis claimed that the qur'an was created in time and was not eternal
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: their opponents of various schools claimed that the qur'an was eternal and perfect existing in heaven before it was revealed to muhammad
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the ashari theology which ultimately became predominant held that the qur'an was uncreated
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: most muslims regard paper copies of the qur'an with extreme veneration wrapping them in a clean cloth keeping them on a high shelf and washing as for prayers before reading the qur'an
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: old qur'ans are not destroyed as wastepaper but burned
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the chronologically earlier suras revealed at mecca are primarily concerned with ethical and spiritual topics
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the later medinan suras mostly discuss social and moral issues relevant to the muslim community
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the qur'an is more concerned with moral guidance than legal instruction and is considered the sourcebook of islamic principles and values
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: muslim jurists consult the hadith or the written record of muhammad's life to both supplement the qur'an and assist with its interpretation
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the science of qur'anic commentary and exegesis is known as tafsir
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the word qur'an means recitation
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: when muslims speak in the abstract about the qur'an they usually mean the scripture as recited in arabic rather than the printed work or any translation of it
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: to muslims the qur'an is perfect only as revealed in the original arabic translations are necessarily deficient because of language differences the fallibility of translators and the impossibility of preserving the original's inspired style
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: translations are therefore regarded only as commentaries on the qur'an or interpretations of its meaning not as the qur'an itself
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: حضرت محمد صلی الله عليه وسلم c
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: بټنوک|220px|کيڼ|مسجد النبوي د پيغمبر(صلی الله علیه وسلم جومات په مدينه کې د حضرت محمد صلی الله عليه وسلم مقبره هم ده
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: there with the medinan converts ansar and the meccan migrants muhajirun muhammad established his political and religious authority
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: within years two battles had been fought against meccan forces the battle of badr in ۶۲۴ which was a muslim victory and the battle of uhud in ۶۲۵ which ended inconclusively
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: conflict with medinan jewish clans who opposed the muslims led to their exile enslavement or death and the jewish enclave of khaybar was subdued
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: at the same time meccan trade routes were cut off as muhammad brought surrounding desert tribes under his control
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: by ۶۲۹ muhammad was victorious in the nearly bloodless conquest of mecca and by the time of his death in ۶۳۲ he ruled over the arabian peninsula
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in islam the normative example of muhammad's life is called the sunnah literally trodden path
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this example is preserved in traditions known as hadith reports which recount his words his actions and his personal characteristics
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the classical muslim jurist ash shafi'i d
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: ۸۲۰ emphasized the importance of the sunnah in islamic law and muslims are encouraged to emulate muhammad's actions in their daily lives
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the sunnah is seen as crucial to guiding interpretation of the qur'an
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the qur'an emphasizes bodily resurrection a break from the pre islamic arabian understanding of death
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: it states that resurrection will be followed by the gathering of mankind culminating in their judgment by god
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the qur'an lists several sins that can condemn a person to hell such as disbelief usury and dishonesty
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: muslims view paradise jannah as a place of joy and bliss with qur'anic references describing its features and the physical pleasures to come
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: there are also references to a greater joy acceptance by god ridwan
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: mystical traditions in islam place these heavenly delights in the context of an ecstatic awareness of god
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in accordance with the islamic belief in predestination or divine preordainment al-qada wa'l qadar god has full knowledge and control over all that occurs
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this is explained in qur'anic verses such as say nothing will happen to us except what allah has decreed for us he is our protector for muslims everything in the world that occurs good or evil has been preordained and nothing can happen unless permitted by god
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in islamic theology divine preordainment does not suggest an absence of god's indignation against evil because any evils that do occur are thought to result in future benefits men may not be able to see
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: according to muslim theologians although events are pre ordained man possesses free will in that he has the faculty to choose between right and wrong and is thus responsible for his actions
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: according to islamic tradition all that has been decreed by god is written in al lawh al mahfuz the preserved tablet
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the shi'a understanding of predestination is called divine justice adalah
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this doctrine originally developed by the mu'tazila stresses the importance of man's responsibility for his own actions
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in contrast the sunni deemphasize the role of individual free will in the context of god's creation and foreknowledge of all things
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: islamic eschatology is concerned with the qiyamah end of the world and the final judgment of humanity
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: like christianity and judaism islam teaches the bodily resurrection of the dead the fulfilment of a divine plan for creation and the immortality of the human soul
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in islamic belief the righteous are rewarded with the pleasures of jannah paradise while the unrighteous are punished in jahannam a fiery hell from the hebrew ge hinnom or valley of hinnom usually rendered in english as gehenna
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: a significant portion of the qur'an deals with these beliefs with many hadith elaborating on the themes and details
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: however the prescriptions and prohibitions may be broad so how they are applied in practice varies
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: islamic scholars the ulema have elaborated systems of law on the basis of these broad rules supplemented by the hadith reports of how muhammad and his companions interpreted them
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: see sin for further discussion about the concept of sin and its atonement according to the islamic law
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in current times not all muslims understand the qur'an in its original arabic
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: thus when muslims are divided in how to handle situations they seek the assistance of a mufti islamic judge who can advise them based on islamic sharia and hadith
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the sharia literally the path leading to the watering place is islamic law formed by traditional islamic scholarship
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in islam sharia is the expression of the divine will and constitutes a system of duties that are incumbent upon a muslim by virtue of his religious belief
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: islamic law covers all aspects of life from matters of state like governance and foreign relations to issues of daily living
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the qur'an defines hudud as the punishments for five specific crimes unlawful intercourse false accusation of unlawful intercourse consumption of alcohol theft and highway robbery
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the qur'an and sunnah also contain laws of inheritance marriage and restitution for injuries and murder as well as rules for fasting charity and prayer
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: however these prescriptions and prohibitions may be broad so their application in practice varies
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: islamic scholars known as ulema have elaborated systems of law on the basis of these rules and their interpretations
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: fiqh or jurisprudence is defined as the knowledge of the practical rules of the religion
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the method islamic jurists use to derive rulings is known as usul al fiqh legal theory or principles of jurisprudence
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: according to islamic legal theory law has four fundamental roots which are given precedence in this order the qur'an the sunnah actions and sayings of muhammad the consensus of the muslim jurists ijma and analogical reasoning qiyas
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: for early islamic jurists theory was less important than pragmatic application of the law
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in the ۹th century the jurist ash shafi'i provided a theoretical basis for islamic law by codifying the principles of jurisprudence including the four fundamental roots in his book ar risalah
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in practice islamic rulers frequently bypassed the sharia courts with a parallel system of so called grievance courts over which they had sole control
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: as the muslim world came into contact with western secular ideals muslim societies responded in different ways
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: turkey has been governed as a secular state ever since the reforms of mustafa kemal ataturk
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in contrast the ۱۹۷۹ iranian revolution replaced a mostly secular regime with an islamic republic led by the ayatollah ruholla khomeini
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: all four accept the validity of the others and a muslim might choose any one that he or she finds agreeable but other islamic sects are believed to have departed from the majority by introducing innovations bidah
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: there are also several orthodox theological or philosophical traditions within sunnism
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: for example the recent salafi movement sees itself as restorationist and claims to derive its teachings from the original sources of islam
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the shi'a who constitute the second largest branch of islam believe in the political and religious leadership of infallible imams from the progeny of ali ibn abi talib
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: they believe that he as the cousin and son in law of muhammad was his rightful successor and they call him the first imam leader rejecting the legitimacy of the previous muslim caliphs
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: to them an imam rules by right of divine appointment and holds absolute spiritual authority among muslims having final say in matters of doctrine and revelation
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: although the shi'a share many core practices with the sunni the two branches disagree over the proper importance and validity of specific collections of hadith
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the shi'a follow a legal tradition called ja'fari jurisprudence
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: shi'a islam has several branches the largest of which is the twelvers (), while the others are the ismaili the seveners and the zaidiyyah
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: shi'a muslims the second largest sect differ from the sunni in rejecting the authority of the first three caliphs
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: they honor different traditions hadith and have their own legal traditions
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: shi'a scholars have a larger authority than sunni scholars and have greater room for interpretation
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the imams play a central role in shi'a doctrine
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the arabic word shi'a litarally translates into the word group or sect
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: originally known as shi'at ali the sect of ali the group formed shortly after the death of ali in iraq
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: ali ibn abi talib was the cousin of prophet muhammad and after marriage to fatima he also became muhammad's son in law
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the shi'a consist of one major school of thought known as the ithna ashariyah or the twelvers and a few minor schools of thought as the seveners or the fivers referring to the number of infallible leaders they recognize after the death of prophet muhammad
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the term shi'a when used without qualification is usually taken to be synonymous with the ithna ashariyya or twelvers
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: most shi'a live in iran iraq the country where ali passed away bahrain lebanon india and pakistan
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: a minority group about ۴ million of shi'a is known as ismaili
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the shia ismaili sect is subdivided into nizari ismaili and mustaali bohra subsects
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the nizari ismaili or are led by the aga khan and are found mainly in pakistan tajikistan bangladesh india canada and united states
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the mustaali bohra sect is further subdivded into dawoodi and sulaimanis subsects
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the dawoodi bohras are concentrated in pakistan and india
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the sulaimani bohras are concentrated in yemen and najran province of saudi arabia
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: not strictly a denomination sufism is a mystical ascetic form of islam
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: by focusing on the more spiritual aspects of religion sufis strive to obtain direct experience of god by making use of intuitive and emotional faculties that one must be trained to use
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: sufism and islamic law are usually considered to be complementary although sufism has been criticized by some muslims for being an unjustified religious innovation
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: most sufi orders or tariqas can be classified as either sunni or shi'a
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: sufism is a spiritual practice followed by both sunni and shi'a
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: sufis generally feel that following islamic law or jurisprudence or fiqh is only the first step on the path to perfect submission they focus on the internal or more spiritual aspects of islam such as perfecting one's faith and fighting one's own ego nafs
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: most sufi orders or tariqa can be classified as either sunni or shi'a
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: however there are some that are not easily categorized as either sunni or shi'a such as the bektashi
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: sufis are found throughout the islamic world from senegal to indonesia
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: wahhabis as they are known by non wahhabis are a smaller more recent sunni group
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: they prefer to be called salafis
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: wahhabism is a movement founded by muhammad ibn abd al wahhab in the ۱۸th century in what is present day saudi arabia
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: they classify themselves as sunni and some claim to follow the hanbali legal tradition
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the major trend however is the abolition of these schools of thoughts legal traditions and the following of a more literalist interpretation
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: some even regard other sunni as heretics
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the hanbali legal tradition is the recognized official school of islamic law in saudi arabia and they have had a great deal of influence on the islamic world because of saudi control of mecca and medina the islamic holy places and because of saudi funding for mosques and schools in other countries
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the majority of saudi islamic scholars are considered as wahhabis by other parts of the islamic world
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: sunni and shi'a have often clashed
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: some sunni believe that shi'a are heretics while other sunni recognize shi'a as fellow muslims
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: according to shaikh mahmood shaltoot head of the al azhar university in the middle part of the ۲۰th century the ja'fari school of thought which is also known as al shi'a al imamiyyah al ithna ashariyyah i.e the twelver imami shi'ites is a school of thought that is religiously correct to follow in worship as are other sunni schools of thought
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: al azhar later distanced itself from this position
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: another sect which dates back to the early days of islam is that of the kharijites
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the only surviving branch of the kharijites are the ibadhi muslims
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: ibadhism is distinguished from shiism by its belief that the imam leader should be chosen solely on the basis of his faith not on the basis of descent and from sunnism in its rejection of uthman and ali and strong emphasis on the need to depose unjust rulers
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: ibadhi islam is noted for its strictness but unlike the kharijites proper ibadhis do not regard major sins as automatically making a muslim an unbeliever
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: most ibadhi muslims live in oman
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: another trend in modern islam is that which is sometimes called progressive
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: followers may be called ijtihadists
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: they may be either sunni or shi'ite and generally favor the development of personal interpretations of qur'an and hadith
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: see liberal islam one very small group based primarily in the united states follows the teachings of rashad khalifa and calls itself the submitters
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: they reject hadith and fiqh and say that they follow the qur'an alone
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: most muslims of both the sunni and the shia sects consider this group to be heretical
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the kharijites are a sect that dates back to the early days of islam
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the only surviving branch of the kharijites is ibadism
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: unlike most kharijite groups ibadism does not regard sinful muslims as unbelievers
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the imamate is an important topic in ibadi legal literature which stipulates that the leader should be chosen solely on the basis of his knowledge and piety and is to be deposed if he acts unjustly
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: most ibadi muslims live in oman
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the yazidi druze ahmadiyya babi baha'i berghouata and ha mim religions either emerged out of islam or came to share certain beliefs with islam
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: sikhism founded by guru nanak in late fifteenth century punjab incorporates aspects of both islam and hinduism
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this testament is a foundation for all other beliefs and practices in islam although technically the shi'a do not consider the shahadah to be a separate pillar just a belief
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: muslims must repeat the shahadah in prayer and non muslims wishing to convert to islam are required to recite the creed
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: many practices fall in the category of adab or islamic etiquette
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this includes greeting others with as salamu alaykum peace be unto you saying bismillah in the name of god before meals and using only the right hand for eating and drinking
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: islamic hygienic practices mainly fall into the category of personal cleanliness and health such as the circumcision of male offspring
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: islamic burial rituals include saying the salat al janazah funeral prayer over the bathed and enshrouded dead body and burying it in a grave
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: muslims like jews are restricted in their diet and prohibited foods include pig products blood carrion and alcohol
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: all meat must come from a herbivorous animal slaughtered in the name of god by a muslim jew or christian with the exception of game that one has hunted or fished for oneself
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: food permissible for muslims is known as halal food
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: jihad means to strive or struggle especially in the idiomatic expression striving in the way of god al-jihad fi sabil allah and is considered the sixth pillar of islam by a minority of muslim authorities
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: jihad in its broadest sense is classically defined as exerting one's utmost power efforts endeavors or ability in contending with an object of disapprobation depending on the object being a visible enemy the devil and aspects of one's own self different categories of jihad are defined jihad against one's own self self-perfection jihad of the tongue jihad of the hand and jihad of the sword
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: jihad when used without any qualifier is understood in its military aspect
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: jihad is the only form of warfare permissible under islamic law
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: under most circumstances and for most muslims jihad is a collective duty fard kifaya one whose performance by some individuals exempts the others for the rest of the populace this happens only in the case of a general mobilization
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: some muslim authorities especially among the shi'a and sufis distinguish between the greater jihad which pertains to spiritual self perfection and the lesser jihad defined as warfare
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: jihad also refers to one's striving to attain religious and moral perfection
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: islam's historical development resulted in major political economic and military effects inside and outside the islamic world
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: within a century of muhammad's first recitations of the qur'an an islamic empire stretched from the atlantic ocean in the west to central asia in the east
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this new polity soon broke into civil war and successor states fought each other and outside forces
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: however islam continued to spread into regions like africa the indian subcontinent and southeast asia
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the islamic civilization was one of the most advanced in the world during the middle ages but was surpassed by europe with the economic and military growth of the west
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: during the ۱۸th and ۱۹th centuries islamic dynasties such as the ottomans and mughals fell under the sway of european imperial powers
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in the ۲۰th century new religious and political movements and newfound wealth in the islamic world led to both rebirth and conflict
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: muhammad began preaching islam at mecca before migrating to medina from where he united the tribes of arabia into a singular arab muslim religious polity
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: with muhammad's death in ۶۳۲ disagreement broke out over who would succeed him as leader of the muslim community
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: umar ibn al khattab a prominent companion of muhammad nominated abu bakr who was muhammad's intimate friend and collaborator
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: others added their support and abu bakr was made the first caliph
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this choice was disputed by some of muhammad's companions who held that ali ibn abi talib his cousin and son in law had been designated his successor
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: abu bakr's immediate task was to avenge a recent defeat by byzantine or eastern roman empire forces although he first had to put down a rebellion by arab tribes in an episode known as the ridda wars or wars of apostasy
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: his death in ۶۳۴ resulted in the succession of umar as the caliph followed by uthman ibn al affan and ali ibn abi talib
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: these four are known as al khulafa ar rashidun rightly guided caliphs
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: under them the territory under muslim rule expanded deeply into persian empire and byzantine territories
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: when umar was assassinated in ۶۴۴ the election of uthman as successor was met with increasing opposition
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in ۶۵۶ uthman was also killed and ali assumed the position of caliph
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: after fighting off opposition in the first civil war the first fitna ali was assassinated by kharijites in ۶۶۱
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: following this mu'awiyah who was governor of levant seized power and began the umayyad dynasty
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: these disputes over religious and political leadership would give rise to schism in the muslim community
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the majority accepted the legitimacy of the three rulers prior to ali and became known as sunnis
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: a minority disagreed and believed that ali was the only rightful successor they became known as the shi'a
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: after mu'awiyah's death in ۶۸۰ conflict over succession broke out again in a civil war known as the second fitna
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: afterward the umayyad dynasty prevailed for seventy years and was able to conquer the maghrib as well as the al andalus the iberian peninsula former visigothic hispania and the narbonnese gaul
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: while the muslim arab elite engaged in conquest some devout muslims began to question the piety of indulgence in a worldly life emphasizing rather poverty humility and avoidance of sin based on renunciation of bodily desires
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: devout muslim ascetic exemplars such as hasan al basri would inspire a movement that would evolve into sufism
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: for the umayyad aristocracy islam was viewed as a religion for arabs only the economy of the umayyad empire was based on the assumption that a majority of non muslims dhimmis would pay taxes to the minority of muslim arabs
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: a non arab who wanted to convert to islam was supposed to first become a client of an arab tribe
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: even after conversion these new muslims mawali did not achieve social and economic equality with the arabs
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the descendants of muhammad's uncle abbas ibn abd al muttalib rallied discontented mawali poor arabs and some shi'a against the umayyads and overthrew them with the help of their propagandist and general abu muslim inaugurating the abbasid dynasty in ۷۵۰
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: under the abbasids islamic civilization flourished in the islamic golden age with its capital at the cosmopolitan city of baghdad
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: by the late ۹th century the abbasid caliphate began to fracture as various regions gained increasing levels of autonomy
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: across north africa persia and central asia emirates formed as provinces broke away
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the monolithic arab empire gave way to a more religiously homogenized muslim world where the shia fatimids contested even the religious authority of the caliphate
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: by ۱۰۵۵ the seljuq turks had eliminated the abbasids as a military power nevertheless they continued to respect the caliph's titular authority
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: during this time expansion of the muslim world continued by both conquest and peaceful proselytism even as both islam and muslim trade networks were extending into sub saharan west africa central asia volga bulgaria and the malay archipelago
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the golden age saw new legal philosophical and religious developments
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the major hadith collections were compiled and the four modern sunni madh'habs were established
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: islamic law was advanced greatly by the efforts of the early ۹th century jurist al shafi'i he codified a method to establish the reliability of hadith a topic which had been a locus of dispute among islamic scholars
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: philosophers ibn sina avicenna and al farabi sought to incorporate greek principles into islamic theology while others like the ۱۱th century theologian abu hamid al ghazzali argued against them and ultimately prevailed
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: finally sufism and shi'ism both underwent major changes in the ۹th century
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: sufism became a full fledged movement that had moved towards mysticism and away from its ascetic roots while shi'ism split due to disagreements over the succession of imams
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the spread of the islamic dominion induced hostility among medieval ecclesiastical christian authors who saw islam as an adversary in the light of the large numbers of new muslim converts
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this opposition resulted in polemical treatises which depicted islam as the religion of the antichrist and of muslims as libidinous and subhuman
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in the medieval period a few arab philosophers like the poet al ma'arri adopted a critical approach to islam and the jewish philosopher maimonides contrasted islamic views of morality to jewish views that he himself elaborated
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: starting in the ۹th century muslim conquests in christian europe began to be reversed
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the reconquista was launched against muslim principalities in iberia and muslim italian possessions were lost to the normans
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: from the ۱۱th century onwards a series of wars known as the crusades brought the muslim world into conflict with christendom
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: successful at first in their capturing of the holy land which resulted in the establishment of the crusader states crusader gains in the holy land were reversed by later muslim generals such as saladin who recaptured jerusalem during the second crusade
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the mongol empire put an end to the abbasid dynasty at the battle of baghdad in ۱۲۵۸ which saw the muslims overrun by the superior mongol army
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: meanwhile in egypt the slave soldier mamluks took control in an uprising in ۱۲۵۰
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the seljuk turks fell apart rapidly in the second half of the ۱۳th century
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in the ۱۳th and ۱۴th centuries the ottoman empire named after osman i was established with a string of conquests that included the balkans parts of greece and western anatolia
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in ۱۴۵۳ under mehmed ii the ottomans laid siege to constantinople the capital of byzantium
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the byzantine fortress succumbed shortly thereafter having been battered by superior ottoman cannonry
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: beginning in the ۱۳th century sufism underwent a transformation largely as a result of the efforts of al ghazzali to legitimize and reorganize the movement
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: he developed the model of the sufi order a community of spiritual teachers and students
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: also of importance to sufism was the creation of the masnavi a collection of mystical poetry by the ۱۳th century persian poet rumi
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the masnavi had a profound influence on the development of sufi religious thought to many sufis it is second in importance only to the qur'an
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in the early ۱۶th century the shi'ite safavid dynasty assumed control in persia and established shi'a islam as an official religion there and despite periodic setbacks the safavids remained powerful for two centuries
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: meanwhile mamluk egypt fell to the ottomans in ۱۵۱۷ who then launched a european campaign which reached as far as the gates of vienna in ۱۵۲۹
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: many islamic dynasties ruled parts of the indian subcontinent starting from the twelfth century
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the prominent ones include the delhi sultanate ۱۲۰۶-۱۵۲۶ and the mughal empire ۱۵۲۶-۱۸۵۷
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: these empires helped in the spread of islam in south asia
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: but by the mid-۱۸th century the british empire had ended the mughal dynasty
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in the ۱۸th century the wahhabi movement took hold in saudi arabia
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: founded by the preacher ibn abd al wahhab wahhabism is a fundamentalist ideology that condemns practices like sufism and the veneration of saints as unislamic
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: by the ۱۷th and ۱۸th centuries despite attempts at modernization the ottoman empire had begun to feel threatened by european economic and military advantages
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in the ۱۹th century the rise of nationalism resulted in greece declaring and winning independence in ۱۸۲۹ with several balkan states following suit after the ottomans suffered defeat in the russo turkish war of ۱۸۷۷-۱۸۷۸
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the ottoman era came to a close at the end of world war i
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: after world war i losses the remnants of the empire were parceled out as european protectorates or spheres of influence
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: since then most muslim societies have become independent nations and new issues such as oil wealth and relations with the state of israel have assumed prominence
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the ۲۰th century saw the creation of many new islamic revivalist movements
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: groups such as the muslim brotherhood in egypt and jamaat e islami in pakistan advocate a totalistic and theocratic alternative to secular political ideologies
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: sometimes called islamist they see western cultural values as a threat and promote islam as a comprehensive solution to every public and private question of importance
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in countries like iran and afghanistan under the taliban revolutionary movements replaced secular regimes with islamist states while transnational groups like osama bin laden's al qaeda engage in terrorism to further their goals
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in contrast liberal islam is a movement that attempts to reconcile religious tradition with modern norms of secular governance and human rights
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: its supporters say that there are multiple ways to read islam's sacred texts and stress the need to leave room for independent thought on religious matters
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in modern times islam has come under criticism from idealogues such as robert spencer and ibn warraq who criticize islamic law and question the morality of the qur'an for example they say that its contents justify mistreatment of women and encourage antisemitic remarks by muslim theologians such claims are disputed by muslim scholars
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: montgomery watt norman daniel and edward said dismiss many of the criticisms as the product of old myths and medieval european polemics
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the rise of islamophobia according to carl ernst had contributed to the negative views about islam and muslims in the west
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: کيڼ|290px|بټنوک|د هېوادونو له مخې د مسلمانانو د شمېر سلنه
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: commonly cited estimates of the muslim population in ۲۰۰۷ range from ۱٫۱ billion to ۱٫۸ billion
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: approximately ۸۵٪ are sunni and ۱۵٪ are shi'a with a small minority belonging to other sects
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: some ۳۰-۴۰ countries are muslim majority and arabs account for around ۲۰٪ of all muslims worldwide
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: south asia and southeast asia contain the most populous muslim countries with indonesia india pakistan and bangladesh having more than ۱۰۰ million adherents each
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: according to us government figures in ۲۰۰۶ there were ۲۰ million muslims in china
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in the middle east the non arab countries of turkey and iran are the largest muslim majority countries in africa egypt and nigeria have the most populous muslim communities
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: islam is the second largest religion after christianity in many european countries
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the basic unit of islamic society is the family and islam defines the obligations and legal rights of family members
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the father is seen as financially responsible for his family and is obliged to cater for their well being
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the division of inheritance is specified in the qur'an which states that most of it is to pass to the immediate family while a portion is set aside for the payment of debts and the making of bequests
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the woman's share of inheritance is generally half of that of a man with the same rights of succession
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: marriage in islam is a civil contract which consists of an offer and acceptance between two qualified parties in the presence of two witnesses
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the groom is required to pay a dowry mahr to the bride as stipulated in the contract
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: a man may marry up to four wives if he believes he can treat them equally while a woman may marry one man only
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in most muslim countries the process of divorce in islam is known as talaq which the husband initiates by pronouncing the word divorce
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: scholars disagree whether islamic holy texts justify traditional islamic practices such as veiling and seclusion purdah
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: starting in the ۲۰th century muslim social reformers argued against these and other practices such as polygamy with varying success
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: at the same time many muslim women have attempted to reconcile tradition with modernity by combining an active life with outward modesty
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: islamist groups and regimes like the taliban mostly seek to continue traditional law as applied to women
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: د اسلامي کاليز ته سپوږميزه کاليزه هم وايي او دا ځکه چې د دې کال مياشتې د سپوږمۍ د حرکت پر بنسټ ټاکل شوي، but differs from other such calendars e.g the celtic calendar in that it omits intercalary months being synchronized only with lunations but not with the solar year resulting in years of either ۳۵۴ or ۳۵۵ days
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this omission was introduced by muhammad because the right to announce intercalary months had led to political power struggles
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: therefore islamic dates cannot be converted to the usual ce/ad dates simply by adding ۶۲۲ years
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: islamic holy days fall on fixed dates of the lunar calendar which means that they occur in different seasons in different years in the gregorian calendar
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the formal beginning of the muslim era was chosen to be the hijra in ۶۲۲ce which was an important turning point in muhammad's fortunes
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the assignment of this year as the year ۱ ah anno hegirae in the islamic calendar was reportedly made by caliph umar
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: it is a lunar calendar with nineteen ordinary years of ۳۵۴ days and eleven leap years of ۳۵۵ days in a thirty year cycle
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: islamic dates cannot be converted to ce/ad dates simply by adding ۶۲۲ years allowance must also be made for the fact that each hijri century corresponds to only ۹۷ years in the christian calendar
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the year ۱۴۲۸ah coincides almost completely with ۲۰۰۷ce
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: islamic holy days fall on fixed dates of the lunar calendar which means that they occur in different seasons in different years in the gregorian calendar
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the most important islamic festivals are eid al fitr arabic عيد الفطر on the ۱ st of shawwal marking the end of the fasting month ramadan and eid al adha arabic عيد الأضحى on the ۱۰ th of dhu al hijjah coinciding with the pilgrimage to mecca
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: * د الاحبش ډله چې د حبشيانو په نامه هم يادېږي/ aicp the following religions are said by some to have evolved or borrowed from islam in almost all cases influenced by traditional beliefs in the regions where they emerged but consider themselves independent religions with distinct laws and institutions the claim of the adherents of the baha'i faith that it represents an independent religion was upheld by the muslim ecclesiastical courts in egypt during the ۱۹۲۰s
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: as of january ۱۹۲۶ their final ruling on the matter of the origins of the baha'i faith and its relationship to islam was that the baha'i faith was neither a sect of islam nor a religion based on islam but a clearly defined independently founded faith
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this was seen as a considerate act on the part of the ecclesiastical court and in favor of followers of baha'i faith since the majority of muslims regard a religion based on islam as a heresy
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: some see sikhism as a syncretic mix of islam and hinduism although it is often considered a dharmic faith rather than an islamic or abrahamic one
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: it arose in the context of the interaction between hindu and muslim communities in north india
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the following religions might have been said to have evolved from islam but are not considered part of islam and no longer exist the classical islamic solution was a limited tolerance - jews and christians were to be allowed to privately practice their faith and follow their own family law
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: they were called dhimmis and they had fewer though similar legal rights and obligations than muslims
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the classic islamic state was often more tolerant than many other states of the time which insisted on complete conformity to a state religion
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the record of contemporary muslim majority states is mixed
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: some are generally regarded as tolerant while others have been accused of intolerance and human rights violations
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: see the main article islam and other religions for further discussion
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: according to islamic doctrine islam was the primordial religion of mankind professed by adam
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: at some point a religious split occurred and god began sending prophets to bring his revelations to the people
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in this view abraham moses hebrew prophets and jesus were all prophets of islam but their message and the texts of the torah and the gospels were corrupted by jews and christians
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: similarly children of non muslim families are born muslims but are converted to another faith by their parents
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the idea of islamic supremacy is encapsulated in the formula islam is exalted and nothing is exalted above it pursuant to this principle muslim women may not marry non muslim men defamation of islam is prohibited and the testimony of a non muslim is inadmissible against a muslim
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: islamic law divides non muslims into several categories depending on their relation with the islamic state
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: christians and jews who live under islamic rule are known as dhimmis
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: dhimmis must pay tribute jizya to the islamic state and as such are considered protected peoples historically dhimmis enjoyed a measure of communal autonomy under their own religious leaders but were subject to legal social and religious restrictions as well as humiliating regulations meant to highlight the inferiority of non muslim subjects
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the status was extended to zoroastrians and sometimes to polytheists such as hindus but not to atheists or agnostics
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: those who live in non muslim lands dar al harb are known as harbis and upon entering into an alliance with the muslim state become known as ahl al ahd
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: those who receive a guarantee of safety while residing temporarily in muslim lands are known as ahl al aman
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: their legal position is similar to that of the dhimmi except that they are not required to pay the jizya
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the people of armistice ahl al hudna are those who live outside of muslim territory and agree to refrain from attacking the muslims
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: apostasy is prohibited and is punishable by death
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: بټنوک|کيڼ|upright|د دوراني پېر پاچايي پوځي سرتېري
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: military history has a number of purposes
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: one main purpose is to learn from past accomplishments and mistakes so as to more effectively wage war in the future
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: another is to create a sense of tradition which is used to create cohesive military forces
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: still another may be to learn to prevent wars more effectively
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: armed forces may be organized as standing forces e.g regular army which describes a professional army that is engaged in no other profession than preparing for and engaging in warfare
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in contrast there is the citizen army
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: a citizen army also known as a militia or reserve army is only mobilized as needed
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: its advantage lies in the fact that it is dramatically less expensive in terms of wealth manpower and opportunity cost for the organizing society to support
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the disadvantage is that such a citizen's army is less well trained and organized
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: a compromise between the two has a small cadre of professional ncos non-commissioned officers and officers who act as a skeleton for a much larger force
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: when war comes this skeleton is filled out with conscripts or reservists former full time soldiers who volunteer for a small stipend to occasionally train with the cadre to keep their military skills intact who form the wartime unit
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this balances the pros and cons of each basic organization and allows the formation of huge armies in terms of millions of combatants necessary in modern large scale warfare
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: see also military reserve
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: :'main article militarism
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: military procurement refers to common regulations and requirements for a ship or a detached unit to requisistion and draw on a base's facilies housing pay and rations for detached personnel supplies most commonly food stocks or materials and vehicles by the service running a primary base e.g army units detached to or staging through an air base a vessel calling at a port near an army or air base an army unit drawing supplies from a naval base
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: military transport would pertain to an equipment trans shipped via a sister service or an individual detached for a technical school operated by a sister service or the travel orders and authorization of such an individual to proceed via a sister services vehicles as well as the drawing loan of transportation assets staff cars hum vees military trucks operating from the primary base command
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: military justice as in the uniform code of military justice
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: most nations have a separate code of law which regulates both certain activities allowed only in war as well as provides a code of law applicable only to a soldier in war or in uniform during peacetime
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: for example in the united states the statutory laws set down by congress to apply to the individual conduct within any military force of the united states are known as the uniform code of military justice
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the code includes specific articles under which a soldier or sailor would be tried for infractions ranging from minor late return petty theft to severe rape murder this code is usually referred to by the acronym ucmj
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: military strength is a term that describes a quantification or reference to a nation's standing military forces or the capacity for fulfillment of that military's role
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: for example the military strength of a given country could be interpreted as the number of individuals in its armed forces the destructive potential of its arsenal or both
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: for example while china and india maintain the largest armed forces in the world the us military is considered to be one of the world's strongest although the certainty of such a claim cannot be ascertained without a detailed analysis of opposing military forces in relation to one another as well as taking into account the field(s of battle and tactics used in such a conflict
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the uk and in some regards israel have also been described as the best trained and operating militaries in the world
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: military brat or simply brat refers to a child with at least one parent who served full time in the armed forces
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: it implies that such an upbringing is different in important ways from that experienced by those in the community at large
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the term brat when used in this context is neither subjective nor derogatory
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: major books for understanding the role of the military and the civilian leadership of the military
lines.name: Pashto

lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: د disease وييکه هغې ناروغۍ ته وايي چې ځانگړې نښې او نښانې لري، خو د syndrome وييکه بيا هغې ناروغي ته وييل کېږي چې گڼ شمېر جوت نښې او علايم لري او ټول يوځای سره پېښېدونکي وي
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: که څه هم چې ډېر داسې حالتونه دي چې پېژندل شوي، خو لا تر اوسه پورې هم د syndromes په نامه ورته اشاره کېږي
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: د دې سره سره، گڼ شمېر نور ناجوت حالتونه او سببونه دي چې په طبي متنونو کې د diseases په توگه ورته اشاره کېږي
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: many different factors intrinsic or extrinsic to a person or plant or animal can cause disease
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: examples of intrinsic factors are genetic defects or nutritional deficiencies
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: an environmental exposure such as second hand smoke is an example of an extrinsic factor
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: many diseases result from a combination of intrinsic and extrinsic factors
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: for many diseases many cause or set of causes has been identified
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: there are many different factors that can cause disease
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: these can be broadly categorized into the following categories such as social psychological chemical and biological
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: some factors may fall into more than one category
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: biochemical causes of disease can be considered as a spectrum where at one extreme disease is caused entirely by genetic factors e.g cag repeats in the huntingtin protein gene that causes huntington's disease and at the other extreme is caused entirely by environmental factors
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: environmental factors include toxic chemicals e.g acetaldehyde in cigarette smoke and dioxins released from the breakdown of agent orange and infectious agents e.g smallpox virus and poliovirus
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: in between these extremes genes e.g nod2/card15 and environmental factors e.g gut microbiota interact to cause disease as seen for example in the inflammatory bowel disease crohn's disease fig 1 right).thumb|right|figure 1
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the biochemical basis of disease
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: some diseases not illustrated here also have a social and psychological basis
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: absence of the genetic or environmental factors in this case results in disease not being manifest
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: koch's postulates can be used to determine whether a disease is caused by an infectious agent
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: to determine whether a disease is caused by genetic factors researchers study the pattern inheritance of the disease in families
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this provides qualitative information about the disease how it is inherited
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: a classic example of this method of research is inheritance of hemophilia in the british royal family
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: more recently this research has been used to identify the apoliprotein e apoe gene as a susceptibility gene for alzheimer's disease though some forms of this gene apoe2 are associated with a lower susceptibility
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: to determine to what extent a disease is caused by genetic factors quantitative information twin studies are used
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: monozygotic twins are genetically identical and likely share a similar environment whereas dizygotic twins are genetically similar and likely share a similar environment
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: thus by comparing the incidence of disease termed concordance rate in monozygotic twins with the incidence of disease in dizygotic twins the extent to which genes contribute to disease can be determined
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: candidate disease genes can be identified using a number of methods
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: one is to look for mutants of a model organism e.g the organisms mus musculus,drosophila melanogaster caenhorhabditis elegans,brachydanio rerio and xenopus tropicalis that have a similar phenotype to the disease being studied
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: another approach is to look for segregation of genes or genetic markers e.g single nucleotide polymorphism or expressed sequence tag fig
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: thumb|right|figure 2
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: genetic markers help locate a disease genea large number of snps spaced throughout the genome have been identified recently in a large project called the hapmap project ).
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the usefulness of the hapmap project and snp typing and their relevance to society was covered in the 27 october 2005 issue of the leading international science journal nature journal
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: a large number of genes have been identified that contribute to human disease
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: these are available from the us national library of medicine which has an impressive range of biological science resources available for free online
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: amongst these resources is online mendelian inheritance in man omim that provides a very very comprehensive list of all known human gene mutations associated with and likely contributing to disease
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: each article at omim is regularly updated to include the latest scientific research
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: additionally each article provides a detailed history of the research on a given disease gene with links to the research articles
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: this resource is highly valuable and is used by the world's top science researchers
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the identification of a condition as a disease rather than as simply a variation of human structure or function can have significant social or economic implications
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the controversial recognitions as diseases of post traumatic stress disorder also known as shell shock repetitive motion injury or repetitive stress injury rsi and gulf war syndrome has had a number of positive and negative effects on the financial and other responsibilities of governments corporations and institutions towards individuals as well as on the individuals themselves
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: the social implication of viewing aging as a disease could be profound though this classification is not yet widespread
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: a condition may be considered to be a disease in some cultures or eras but not in others
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: oppositional defiant disorder attention deficit hyperactivity disorder and increasingly obesity are conditions considered to be diseases in the united states and canada today but were not so considered decades ago and are not so considered in some other countries
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: lepers were a group of afflicted individuals who were historically shunned and the term leper still evokes social stigma
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: fear of disease can still be a widespread social phenomena though not all diseases evoke extreme social stigma
lines.name: Pashto

lines.value: a disease can also be caused by repeated high anger or stress
lines.name: Pashto

lines.name: Pashto
